## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I've heard that Verus offers some interesting capabilities for users who want to create their own tokens or blockchains. Can you tell me more about that?

**AI Assistant:**
Verus allows users to create their own token currencies or even full-fledged, multi-currency, ID-issuing blockchains without programming. These blockchains can send and receive from the Verus chain that launched them, and are 50% POW/50% POS and 51% hash attack resistant. This means that users can create their own customized blockchains with ease, without needing to have extensive programming knowledge.

**User:**
That sounds really powerful. I've also heard about the Verus DeFi protocol. What's the advantage of using it for liquidity pools and fractional currency baskets?

**AI Assistant:**
The Verus DeFi protocol ensures that all currency conversions using a particular liquidity pool and mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously. This addresses the problems of miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running, while providing fee-based DeFi integrated incentives to miners and stakers. This means that users can create liquidity pools and fractional currency baskets with confidence, knowing that they're protected from MEV and front-running.

**User:**
I've also come across bridge converter currencies in Verus. What flexibility do they have?

**AI Assistant:**
Bridge converter currencies in Verus have the same flexibility as other fractional 100% asset-backed or partially asset-backed currencies. However, they are bound to the launch of the new blockchain and run on the new blockchain. This means that bridge converter currencies can be used to create customized currency solutions that are tied to specific blockchains, while still offering a high degree of flexibility.

Let me know if you have any more questions about Verus or its capabilities!
What capabilities does Verus offer for users who want to create their own tokens or blockchains without needing to program?

Verus allows users to create their own token currencies or even full-fledged, multi-currency, ID-issuing blockchains without programming. These blockchains can send and receive from the Verus chain that launched them, and are 50% POW/50% POS and 51% hash attack resistant.

nted on non-Verus systems.
## Multi-currency, user created, decentralized tokens and merge-mineable, interoperable blockchains without programming
- Enables any user with an ID to create their own token currency or even full fledged, multi-currency, ID-issuing 50% POW/50% POS, 51% hash attack resistant blockchain that can send and receive from the Verus chain which launched it. All PBaaS chains run from the same daemon, and projects may choose to join the worldwide Verus community in improving the daemon. In doing so, they will start with a complete, multi-currency, ID-capable blockchain with DeFi capabilities that is merge-mineable and stakeable with other blockchains in the Verus network.
## Consensus integrated DeFi liquidity pools and fractional currency baskets
- Any ID owner may define Verus DeFi fractional basket currencies with one or more asset currencies backing the liquidity pool at a fractional percentage ranging from 5% to 100% backing. The Verus DeFi protocol ensures that all currency conversions that use a particular liquidity pool and are mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously, addressing the problems of miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running, while providing fee-based DeFi integrated incentives to miners and stakers, ensuring smooth consensus operation and fee conversion capabilities by integrating DeFi liquidity pools directly into the consensus and cross-chain bridge protocols.
## Simultaneous blockchain and blockchain liquidity pool launches
- Launch of a world class, worldwide, merge-mineable blockchain along with a fully decentralized or centralized “bridge” converter liquidity pool as part of defining a new blockchain. Bridge converter currencies have the same flexibility as other fractional 100% asset backed or partially asset backed currencies, but is bound to the launch of the new blockchain, runs on the new blockcha
